meanings.definition: To present (something) in a new or different way.
meanings.sent1: She decided to rehash her presentation to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent2: The author tends to rehash the same plot in all of his books.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's attempt to rehash old jokes fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist rehashed traditional painting techniques to create a modern masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: After the workshop, she was able to rehash the information in a clear and concise manner.

meanings.definition: To rework old material into a new form.
meanings.sent1: He had to rehash the old report to include the latest data.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to rehash the leftovers into a delicious new dish.
meanings.sent3: The students were asked to rehash their essays using different examples.
meanings.sent4: The designer rehashed vintage fashion trends into a trendy new collection.
meanings.sent5: She always finds a way to rehash old songs into fresh, modern tunes.

meanings.definition: A reworking or restatement of already familiar material.
meanings.sent1: The movie was just a rehash of the original with no new twists.
meanings.sent2: The book felt like a rehash of the author's previous work.
meanings.sent3: The team's strategy was a rehash of what they had tried before.
meanings.sent4: The play was criticized for being a rehash of a classic story.
meanings.sent5: The presentation felt like a rehash of what we had already discussed.
